programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave has his eye on an electronics locker, and Darrell uncovers a classic movie prop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out a 1974 Triumph Convertible, a pair of whale spears come into the shop, and Chum relives his childhood with a pair of Popeye water pistols.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey comes face to face with a Ronald Reagan foam head, but it remains to be seen whether he will make an offer on the piece.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les questions Ashley's management skills when two employees get into a fight on the shop floor. Meanwhile, Seth stumbles upon a potentially huge deal.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les hatches a secret plan to put his employees to the test, but how will Seth, Ashley and Karen react when they find out.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Brettly restores a 19th-century gun vending machine, while Rick and the team work on the meter from a 1950s taxi.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The guys restore a police phone box from New York, and Tyler brings a 1947 railway maintenance vehicle into the shop, but underestimates how much it will cost to repair.

programme.title: Nightmare in Suburbia
programme.desc: How police identified the remains of a man found in Sheffield in 2000 and discovered the cause of his death using a clay mould of his decomposed face.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: Detectives encounter a rogues' gallery of suspects and outlandish leads on their way to finding the killer of telemarketing manager David Stevens.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Jenny Grumbles competes against her rivals to buy the locker of her dreams, while one of her fellow bidders demonstrates a darker side.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A stranger on a motorbike drives up the prices at an auction in DeSoto, where there are only four lockers up for grabs.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks Alan Davies, Anneka Rice, Sean Lock and Bill Bailey for more interesting answers on subjects including beavers, bulges and bacteria in the mind-boggling quiz show.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regular contributor Hugh Dennis present a special edition of the topical comedy show featuring the best of series 15 as well as out-takes from it.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry asks Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Bill Bailey and Jimmy Carr for more interesting answers on subjects including bears, bulbs and bamboo in the mind-boggling quiz show.

programme.title: Flack
programme.desc: Robyn has to get entitled stand-up comic Dan (guest star Alan Davies) out of a hole after he is accused by a transgender comedian of being trans-phobic.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Ellie Taylor, Steve Pemberton, Fern Britton and Josh Widdicombe test their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Great Central Railway's Scott Manley takes a rainy busman's holiday working as a guard at Bury, while a team of volunteers in Wales try to keep the line clear of overgrown plants.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A settlement in Argentina destroyed by floods, a town in the US that has been erased, and a Soviet dream-town that turned into a nuclear nightmare.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Allied offensive in the Pacific, where America's two-pronged attack led to heavy casualties on both sides, as the Japanese mounted a ferocious defence. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Tesla automotive manufacturing facility, where the world's strongest robots produce 2000 cars a week. Featuring a comparison with the world's first production line.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: An informant is due to give evidence against his former boss, one of Glasgow's most powerful gang leaders - but police fail to get the witness to court. Drama, with Mark McManus, Blythe Duff and James MacPherson. Co-star Gray O'Brien makes one of six appearances in the series, years before playing Tony Gordon in Coronation Street. More recently he popped up in The Loch, and Shakespeare & Hathaway: Private Investigators. Director Richard Holthouse went on to helm several episodes of Midsomer Murders.

credits.director: Richard Holthouse went on to helm several episodes of Midsomer Murders

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor is flattered by the attentions of charming Dr Hunter, at least on first impressions, but soon changes her opinion when his housekeeper dies suddenly.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Staff shortages cause tension in CPU, with Ramani bearing the brunt as she struggles to cope with an increased workload - and when an outside source brings the matter to Adam's attention, the situation becomes hugely political, only serving to aggravate the already volatile relationship between Jack and Neil. By way of an immediate solution, Jack assigns Terry to help Ramani with the case of a man suspected of being a paedophile - but Ramani is worried about Terry's ability to deal with such a task given his own traumatic background. Meanwhile, the rest of the relief let their hair down at Lance's stag party - but when the guest of honour nips outside for a breath of fresh air, he is suddenly attacked from behind by a group who put a bag over his head and bundle him into the back of a van. It could just be a stag night prank - or it could be something more serious. Guest starring Annabelle Apsion and Colm O'Maonlai.

programme.desc: A Wiltshire couple are stunned with their open plan makeover, seeing is believing with an upcycled kitchen in Perthshire, an artist creates a stunning Lake District studio and a Welwyn couple add to their garden with a rum shack.Â Presented by Linda Barker.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.desc: It's the ultimate battle of the decades! We're putting the girls of the 90s up against the girls of the 00s to see who did it best.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Kisstory: Old Skool & Anthems
programme.desc: It's time to go back in time with KISSTORY! The biggest old skool anthems ever from your favourite artists.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: Chart Hits & New Vids
programme.desc: We've got all the hits that are storming the charts right now, along with some brand new releases from your favourite and new artists.

programme.title: Hit After Hit
programme.desc: Nothing but the biggest hits by your favourite stars back to back.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how the sitar, a classic Indian instrument, is crafted, how beef biltong is made, and how large bulldozers are built.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer invests in a rare 1967 amphibious car, but it has some underlying problems that could eat away at his potential profit margin.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini is delighted to find a 1963 427 Cobra in a barn, and he and Roger manage to get it running and take it for a ride.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini goes to a sale in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, in a bid to purchase a range of Ford cars that were made between 1935 and 1940

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part one of two. Rick Petko gets a surprise when Paul Teutul Sr starts to build a bike for him. Mikey Teutul comes in to help and add a touch of inspiration.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Presenter Dan Short and the team take on a 1965 Ford Mustang fastback and a 1951 Studebaker truck.

programme.title: Heli-Loggers
programme.desc: Gord Closson and his crew battle against heavy snowfall on Vancouver Island as they try to harvest 50 trees in two days.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The development and creation of filigree glass, fish food and motor homes.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacture of surgical instruments, ketchup and double-decker buses.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: In Nashville, Tennessee, Kelly Quinn is brutally attacked in her home by two assailants. FBI officers launch an investigation to identify those responsible before they strike again.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A man risks everything in the hunt for his sister's killer, and a sexual predator is getting away with his crimes.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: How a group of young men in New Jersey, fascinated by Mafia depictions in films such as Goodfellas, formed their own criminal gang. Things soon escalated as the members began to turn on each other.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The deaths of Alabama country store owner Billy Triplett and his wife Debbie in June 2001. Locals suspected their fate must have been connected with his illegal side-business of retailing alcohol. However, when word of a bloodstained stash of money reached investigators, they were shocked to realise the identity of the person wishing to conceal it.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The IRS analyses a number of unusual clues that help locate the kidnapper of a wealthy businessman's wife, who was abducted in 1988.

programme.title: Animal Cops
programme.desc: Investigators rescue 70 dogs running loose on a property in Texas and agents help a woman in Detroit with 90 cats.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown is desperate to save the life of a frail three-day old foal that has just been orphaned. Plus, Dr Lisa Chimes is trying to help a greedy cat that ate a 50cm ribbon.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Rochelle brings her family over from California to help her choose her dress, including her opinionated father, and a girl finds it difficult to stay within her budget.
